p: For the T = 100 year lake levels in Fig. 10b, considerable variations in the magnitudes of the lake levels can also be seen in all three models. These range from a maximum of 477.9 m ASVD (AMS2) to a minimum of 476.1 m ASVD (AMS1). In addition, AMS1 has quantiles above the stationary 100-year levels for approximately 18% of the time, whereas AMS2 and AMS3 account for 50% and 60% of the time, respectively. It can also be noted that AMS3 quantiles exhibit the most changes for the T = 100-year lake levels.
